text: Bardzo dobry porterek, fajna kawa. No oczywi≈õcie te aromaty mas≈Ça orzechowego swoje robiƒÖ, ale generalnie piwo bardzo fajne.

Aromat: s≈Çodki, ciƒô≈ºki, bardzo przyjemny, mas≈Ço orzechowe, czekolada mleczna, kawa. Bardzo czekoladowe i jeszcze mocniej czekoladowe mas≈Ço orzechowe.
WyglƒÖd: ciemnobrƒÖzowe, jasnobe≈ºowa, ≈õredniopƒôcherzykowa piana, na oko≈Ço centymetr, szybko zanika.
Smak: dosyƒá lekkie, cia≈Ça stosunkowo niewiele, mas≈Ço czekoladowe ju≈º nie tak silne jak w aromacie, ale wciƒÖ≈º na pierwszym planie. Dalej czekolada mleczna, czekolada na gorƒÖco, sporo kawy. Lekko cierpkie na finiszu, odczucie g≈Çadko≈õci i lekko≈õci jakby tu by≈Ça laktoza. Mi tu ta cierpko≈õƒá trochƒô przeszkadza, taka kwa≈õno≈õƒá kawowa i od s≈Çod√≥w palonych. W smaku bardzo intensywne, ≈ºeby nie powiedzieƒá lekko mƒôczƒÖce, towarzyszy mi te≈º odczucie sztuczno≈õci, niezbyt co prawda silne ale jednak. W sumie ciekawe ale mnie na pewno nie zachwyci≈Ço, aromat i tak mocno podciƒÖgnƒÖ≈Ç ocenƒô.

Bottle (from boxbeers). Pours dark brown with light brownish head. Aroma is sweet, cocoa, nuts, nutella, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, cocoa, peanut butter, nutella, malt, some roast, touch of coffee. Finish is nutella. Body is on the thin side, carbo is rather high. Overall: decent peanut butter beer, tastes like omnipollo or something,..

Impressive! Nose is full of it, taste is immense rich and the palate leaves not wish unfulfilled - if you want coffee. Ice coffee is such bulls hit butbut is takes it to new heights. For the low ABV it has impressive roundness and the taste is light sour with real coffee beans with their original aciduous taste. Me like.

bottle from boxbeers pitch dark, light brown head.
very very strong and heavy aroma of dark chocolate and dark caramel.
flavor is chocolate, peanuts, roasted malts, dark caramel.. I find this beer a bit too much, it tastes more like peanuts and caramel and chocolate than it taste of roasted malts and hops. Somehow i find it quite messy.

22 oz from tavour. Nice medium
Bodied coffee stout. Lots of nice recese pieces and medium roast coffee. Really nice and balanced. Almost no indication of alcohol.

From tap. Dark brown, nearly black, medium frothy tan head. Enticing aroma of peanuts, chocolate, malt. Flavors feature peanut butter first, then coffe, then toasty malts. Long, delicious mocha finish. Well balanced.

22 oz bottle served in a Porter Bar goblet.

Appearance: pours dark brown color with a large, creamy tan head that has very good retention and leaves some lacing on the glass

Aroma: toasted brown bread, coffee, chocolate and peanut butter cookies. Hints of vanilla and light spicing. 

Flavor: dark roasted grains, medium roasted earthy coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa nibs, roasted peanuts & faint toffee. 

Medium-full body with medium-high carbonation.

Overall: a very tasty, if imperfectly balanced mix of cocoa, peanut butter, coffee and dark roasted grains.

@ Budapest, Hungary üëåüèªüëåüèªüëå

650ml bottle @ Jamie¬ís. Pours opaque dark brown with a tiny beige head. Nose is a huge amount of peanut butter. Flavour reminds me of a not entirely sweet halloween candy, those toffee ones wrapped in wax paper. There is a mild roast character. Tasty stuff.
Pours black with a thin foam that quickly dies away. Although this is a coffee infusion, the chocolate and powdered cocoa dominate the profile. It¬ís a good beer to drink.
Aroma is a mix of coffee and chocolate/rocky road. The flavor is chocolate/rocky road, dark/roasted malts, coffee and a mix of mild/medium sweetness and acidity in the finish.
bomber pours black with frothy tan head aroma is coffee with lactose taste is same with mild roast
Pitch black colour with medium beige head.Aroma of coffee beans and chocolate nice smooth with flavor of hazelnuts and cream nice overall.

65cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck. U: Zwart met licht bruine schuimkraag. G: Chocolade, geroosterd en veel hazelnoten. Bijna vloeibare nutella-pasta! S: Zoet met een lichte moutbitterheid. Soms wat waterachtig. Chocolade, opnieuw veel hazelnoten en wat geroosterde toetsen. S: Nogal dunne body, niet sticky en weinig carbonatie.

Draught at √òlbaren.
Black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of caramel and chocolate with notes of hazelnuts.
Sweet and roasted flavor of caramel, chocolate and nougat.
Roasted finish.

From tap at √òlbaren, Copenhagen, 01.04.17. Almost ebony. Very persisten and dense brown head and lacing. Aroma of molasses, vanilla, dark chocolate, coconut and peanuts. Similar taste, with lots of peanuts and peanut butter. Heavy drinking.

Hoppin¬í Frog Tower Tuesday: Infusion A - Coffee Porter
Porter
947415

Lukt: Kaffe, sjokolade, mokka, oboy, vanilje.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tykt dekkende skum.
Smak: Svak kaffe, sjokolade, kakao, oboy, vassen avslutning.
Hvor: Lokal tasting p√• Bryne.

(Hoppin¬í Frog Tower Tuesday: Infusion A - Coffee Porter) Bottle 650ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 6.2%
Black colour on the body, tall and thick beige head on top, good retention.
Aroma of chocolate, cocoa, vanilla.
Taste also of chocolate, nougat, cocoa, hazelnut, vanilla. A bit of coffee on the finish.
Medium thick body, good carbonation.
Pretty good.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2017 Ca√±a en el se√±or lupulo Gij√≥n 16..03..2017 (r119). Color negro intenso con poca espuma beige oscuro que desaparece al poco tiempo aromas intensos e inmemsos a caf√©s torrefactos con Vainillas y frutos secos. Sabores intensos tambi√©n caf√©s torrefactos Vainillas y mantequilla de cacahuete y frutos secos. Cuerpo medio no muy denso algo l√≠quido fino y ligeramente espumoso. Incre√≠ble sabor para sus 6 vol. Para repetir sin duda. muy buena.

Refrigerated brown bomber poured into a English pint glass. Black with small beige head. Aroma is coffee, medium body, medium carbonation, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is coffee, chocolate, lactose, some peanut butter, and a little roast.  The best coffee Porter I have had.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. JEZUS MARIA JAKIE MAS≈ÅO ORZECHOWE

Tap @RB Best. Pours opaque black with a large creamy tan head that dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Aroma is chocolate, light coffee, light ashtray, lots of peanuts. Flavor is medium bitter, light plus sweet, Medium body. Not bad, but just once again reinforces that PB Porters are not really my thing.
Mooie bruine, bijna zwarte kleur. Ruikt sterk chocolade, mout, koffie, cocoa. Smaakt smaakt zoetig, cacao, chocolade, koffie.
Ruikt als een stuk chocola, Nice. Smaakt een beetje lichter dan je fan verwacht, maar is ook niet zo sterk. Iets dikker was nog beter geweest, maar al super.

On tap@: pours black, oily with creamy light brown head. Aroma: huge coffe note, supported with vanilla & peanut butter. Flavor isn¬ít so intense as aroma, but still pleasant. Body is medium, texture silky, carbonation is moderate.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Dark brown pour with a quickly dissipating head. Aromas of Nutella, dark chocolate, dark roast coffee, cocoa. Flavours of chocolate hazlenut, lots of coffee, more nuts. More nuts than an insane asylum! Very tasty.

On tap at hopaholic. Black colour, small brown lacing. Nose is coffee cocoa, candy. Yummy. Taste is roased malts, coffee and cocoa. Light sweet taste. Light lingering bitter aftertaste. Lidl nutella copy taste.
Bottle @ New Years Eve! Light blackish pour with a thin tan head. Tons of milky chocolate, sweet vanilla, caramel, light coffee and some slight roast. Very good!

Bottle. Sensoric. Deep brown/black with moderate to high, light brown, semi-thick, creamy head. Moderate head retention and average lacing. Moderate to heavy malty aroma, mainly roasted - coffee, chocolate, dusty. Lots of peanut butter, along with milk chocolate notes, than again peanut butter, somewhere in the background dull, corky porter notes. Slightly ripe fruits and toffee notes. Taste is moderately to highly sweet, moderately bitter, dusty. Medium body, creamy and oily texture, average carbonation, finish is peanut butter, hazelnut, ashy, little dark fruits. Summary: Very decent brew. Perfectly combination of straight porter character with peanut butter, milk chocolate and creamy notes. One of the best porters I¬íve recently tasted. Podsumowanie: Piwo godne polecenia, nie jest mo≈ºe wybitne, ale na pewno wyjƒÖtkowe. Przede wszystkim mas≈Ço orzechowe, orzechy laskowe, mleczna czekolada, toffi, trochƒô aromat√≥w ziemistych, lekka goryczka, w tle nuty korkowe. Wysoce pijalne.

Draft. Mega peanut-coffee aroma, no surprise as the coffee beans used in the beer are peanut-flavored. Flavors of peanut, a hint of chocolate and a lot of coffee. As the beer warms, the peanut rather overwhelms. The chemical peanut taste has lingered for 45 minutes after I¬íve finished the beer. Very 1988.
Bomber from bestway. Creamy milky coffee porter. A little toasty on the finish. Tan head. Roasty malt. Some chocolate. Good balance and presence.

Taste: big complex rich roasted dark chocolate malt, bold peanut butter flavors with some coffee dry notes. The nose is sweet, peanut butter and chocolate. Black, opaque, with a tall, tan head of foam, some lace. Filling full body but not sticky. Dessert ale.

22 ounce bottle into signature pint glass, no bottle dating. Pours nearly opaque dark brown/black color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big peanut butter, milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toffee, vanilla, cream, and toasted dark bread; with lighter notes of smoke, dark fruit, herbal, and roast/toasted earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome complexity and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee/PB, and light earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big peanut butter, milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toffee, vanilla, cream, and toasted dark bread; with lighter notes of smoke, dark fruit, herbal, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light herbal hop and roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of peanut butter, milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, toffee, vanilla, cream, toasted dark bread, herbal, smoke, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee/PB, and light earthy hop flavors; with a great roasted bitter/sweet balance, and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from roast/hop bitterness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready, fairly silky, and lightly sticky/chalky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6.2%. Overall this is an incredible flavored American porter! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, coffee/PB, and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. Very rich and complex, with a ton of PB and Coffee flavor; with nice support and balance from the base beer. A highly enjoyable offering.

650ml bottle. Jet black colour with average, creamy, fairly lasting and lacing, beige head. Roasty, dark malty aroma, hints of coffee, burnt coffee, a nuttily touch, peanut, peanut butter, hints of vanilla flavoured chocolate. Taste is dry, roasty dark malty and minimally nutty, delivers identical flavours of burnt coffee, peanut and vanilla; very well controlled sweetness.
Aroma of peanut butter. Dark lacey appearance. Starts strong and have a very heavy peanut butter on the front. Coffee comes in late right off the peanut butter taste. Great finish, great beer.

Fabulous aromas of chocolate, nuts and whipped cream. Wonderful taste of chocolate, black malt, coffee, soy and sweetness. Good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Lovely beer but had higher expectations of this beer. A little stronger flavor was lacking. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

(650ml bottle from kihoskh.dk shared) Pours black with a small pale tan head that fades quickly without lace. Aroma of coffee beans, peanut butter and nutella, chocolate, toasted malt, some dark caramel sweetness, pretty much driven by the additions. Flavour leans more on toffee, chocolate, moderate roasted malt and coffee, with the peanut butter hidden at first, fairly sweet though not rich. Finish is drier with bitter coffee grounds, roasted malt, peanut butter, and some cocoa. Light to medium bodied, with average carbonation. Solid stuff, it¬ís easy to get too over the top rich with a sweet high alcohol dessert beer, but in contrast this was maybe slightly underbuilt.

Special mais tellement riche pour ce degr√© d¬íalcool.
Nez : caf√© caf√© et caf√©. Un fond plus gras, un peu vanille et chocolat/chocolat blanc.
La bouche part beaucoup plus sur le beurre, la cannelle, le caf√©, un dessert quoi. La longueur est mod√©r√©e (un rien √©coeurante).

Label made no mention of peanut butter, but it¬ís obviously there, and done expertly well. It¬ís silky indeed with a perfect balance of coffee, malt and luxurious peanut butter. What a fantastic surprise!

Bottle, 650 ml from Beergium. Shared with JFK10000 and Josip. Pours dark brown with average creamy light brown head. Malty, roasted, coffee, nutty, light to moderate sweetness with moderate to heavy bitter finish, Medium bodied.

Thank you Mathieu87 + PriorL for the effort! Bomber sampled @ Samson en Geert Bierproef Avond. Lighter shade of black going to brown, creamy small mocha head. Nose is pleasant big artificial mocha, hazlenut, chocolate, marzipan, coffee, sugar, mocha. Taste is painfully chemical vanilla, marzipan, artificial coffee, chemical cheap chocolate, insanely artificial, the more you drink it the more chemical it becomes, real plastic chocolate & it quickly starts turning artificial, cheap, chemical, painfully artificial & the same counts for the body. Starts out pleasantly but quickly turns ugly.

Bottle from BelgianBeerGal. Dark black with a tall tan head. Strong dark chocolate and dark roast coffee aroma. Taste is semisweet chocolate with a bit of bitterness in the finish. Big flavor, smooth. Nice one.

And so it came to pass that six like minded people met on the 20th day of November in the year of 2016: those six people shared twenty five fine beers. This is one of those twenty five. Bomber. Weak tanned head on a dark brown body, aroma had chocolate and nut esters, add some smooth coffee and you have the taste too. Really slick Porter, loved it.

Bottle @ Rich¬ís 7k tasting. Pours very dark, thin tan head. Pretty intense aroma of nutella & crispy praline. In fact one of the best tasting beers of this year I reckon. Taste continues along a similar theme, lots of smooth chocolate, peanut butter and moderate coffee with nutella creeping back in on the finish. Wonderful beer.
Bottle shared at MTG III via Beer Gonzo; dark brown pour with a thin tan head, aroma has nutella, taste has hazelnut, milk chocolate, hints of coffee, vanilla, pretty awesome.

Appearance: Darker brown black. full finger of tan tiny bubbles.
Nose: Rich Coffee bittersweet notes. Roasty cereal. Mild caramel
Taste: Big rich coffee with bits of sweetness. Typical dark roasted notes. hints of chocolate
Body: Medium to fuller
Parting thoughts: A very nice coffee porter. A bit boozy. Very nice.

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, peanut butter, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown/dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, vanilla, peanut butter and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. So many added ingredients, creating an extremely rich flavour together. The coffee is the least noticeable of these, but creates the perfect balance at the end. The palate could have been thicker, but otherwise this is an amazing beer; especially for its abv.

It pours dark brown with a beige color head. The aroma is just awesome: sweet nuttiness like peanut butter and a slight hint of coffee. Flavour is nutty again, ground coffee, coffee beans, little earthy, little astringency. Unluckily the mouthfeel is not that good: quite watery and a thin body. I would prefer a full one with creamy texture. What a pity! I would have given this a way better rating, if only...

Bottle from Saveur-Biere. Clear, dark brown beer with quite small and quickly disappearing head. Strong aroma is delicious. It has lots of chocolate, peanut butter, almond and hazelnut. Some roasted aroma also. Reminds me of finnish company Fazer¬ís "Wiener nougat". Taste is, however, not too sweet. It has chocolate, some hints of roasted coffee, peanuts and vanilla. Medium body, a bit dry at the end, which makes everything in good balance. Might be a bit watery/too light body, but overall wonderful beer!

22 oz bottle. Pours dark brown with a big frothy light tan head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is huge roast chocolate, peanut butter and hazelnut.

The flavor is sweet fudgy chocolate, peanut butter and hazelnut coffee with a lot of roast. The mouthfeel is medium bodied and a little watery.

Overall, a nice dessert beer. Lots of chocolate, peanut butter and hazelnut with not a ton of coffee coming through.

Bottle. WOW! immediately hit with Reese¬ís Peanut Butter Cup notes upon pouring the beer. Black bodied with a medium, frothy brown head. Aroma is big chocolate and peanut butter with roasted malt and soft coffee. Taste is dark chocolate Reese¬ís Peanut Butter Cups with roasted malt, burnt caramel and coffee notes. Delicious! Body is medium with a creamy but bubbly carbonation. Ends with more Reese¬ís Peanut Butter Cups, dark chocolate, roasted malt and light coffee. Nice!
Pours black with light beige head. Aroma is vanilla, milk chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted, medium sweet, milk chocolate and vanilla.

Draft. Pours a medium, slowly collapsing, beige head, with minimal lacing, over a clear dark brown (SRM 32) body........nose is heavy roasted malts, with enormous chocolate, mild cocoa, minimal hops, balance to the malts......taste is lightly lactose type sweet with heavy roasted malts, with loads of chocolate, light coffee, finishing almost dry, with hints of hop bitterness, balance to the malts.......mouth feel, medium, slightly sticky body,no alcohol, light carbonation. This is called a coffee Porter, but the coffee is quite hidden by the slightly less roasted, but still heavily roasted chocolate tones from the malts. Let it warm, and the coffee comes up a bit. Think of it almost as a dessert type beer. BJCP 9/3/15/4/7

Bottle at tasting. Dark pour. Delicious aroma of creamy coffee, vanilla, mocha and hopjesvla. Rich flavor, with lots of delicious hopjesvla, mocha, creamy milk chocolate, coffee and peanut butter. This was a nice surprise, fantastic beer.

Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of coffee, peanuts, sweet caramel, roasted malts. Black colour with off-white head, not lasting. Taste is moderate and moderate sweet. Full body, thick feel and roasted coffee peanut finish.

Pours black with a medium foamy mocha head. Aromas of chocolate, lactose, roasted nuts, roasted malt, peanut butter, coffee. Taste is roasted and chocolatey with prominent nutty notes and slight coffee notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

On tap. Pours a dark brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of chocolate fudge, peanut butter, vanilla, chocolate malt. Flavor of peanut butter, chocolate, roasted malt. Lots of chocolate in the nose and peanut butter in the flavor. A delicious dessert beer!
8/4/8/4/14 (3.8/5)
Bottle. Pours near black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, peanut butter and coffee. Flavor was quite sweet with caramel, peanut butter, coffee, chocolate and vanilla.

Kran w Brewdog Warsaw. Barwa czarna, z niewysokƒÖ szaro-be≈ºowƒÖ pianƒÖ. Aromat bardzo przyjemny mo≈ºna wyczuƒá m.in. mas≈Ço orzechowe, kawƒô, czekoladƒô. W smaku przewaga kawy i czekolady. G≈Çadkie, pe≈Çne, kremowe.

Bottle at home. Aroma is dark malt, intense coffee, mocha, hazelnuts, nutella, notes of peanut butter, milk chocolate, touch of roast. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter. Body is medium, slightly creamy. Lots of coffee and nuts, really tasty ¬íbreakfast Porter¬í.

Bottle from Hop City Birmingham escaping Hurricane Hermine. Dark cola coloring with a bubbly brown head that lasts. Big aroma of milk chocolate, coffee and I swear peanut butter. Flavor starts lightly sweet and finishes with some baking chocolate bitterness. Reminiscent of a well made sweet stout in some ways. Very nice.

Keg at Cask Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, chocolate, peanut butter, coffee aroma. Tastes more or less the same, slightly malty, chocolate, peanut butter, coffee, slightly sweet. Incredibly easy to drink, nice porter from Ohio.

Piwo zabija aromatem du≈ºo s≈Çodkiej kawy, a do tego orzechy, budy≈Ñ czekoladowy i wanilia. S≈Çodko i niezwykle przyjemnie.
W smaku za to Hoppin¬í Frog przenosi nas do zupe≈Çnie innej bajki. Piwo owszem jest kawowe i czekoladowe, ale za to wytrawne i stosunkowo lekkie. Bardzo pijalne. Fajny aromat szkoda tylko, ≈ºe zawdziƒôczamy to dodatkiem aromat√≥w.

Deep ambery brown colour, small off-white head. Aroma is nutty, mild ashes, some toffee and also a bit ripe fruits and raisins. Flavour is chocolaty, nutty, wooden and some slight ripe fruits and toffee.
On tap. With peanut butter. Blank with one finger biege head. Chocolate and peanut butter aroma. Nice amount of peanut butter taste, coffee, dry finish. Nice beer.

W aromacie super intensywna kawa, mas≈Ço orzechowe, orzechy, tyto≈Ñ, miazga! W smaku o dziwo do≈õƒá lekkie, wytrawne, pozostawiajƒÖce niedosyt, zbyt mocno nagazowane, ale... przez to sesyjne. Wiƒôcej g≈Çadko≈õci i dodatk√≥w odczuwalnych w smaku a by≈Çaby totalna masakra!

Keg at the CP&K, 25/08/16.
Extremely dark mahogany brown with a well appointed beige cap.
Nose is hazelnuts, sweet malt, cocoa powder, light roast.
Taste comprised Nutella, cocoa powder, fruit cake, light spice, peanut butter tinge, subtle coffee grinds.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent enough porter if a touch overly sweet.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Tower Tuesday Series Infusion A Coffee Porter by Hoppin¬í Frog Brewery at BrewDog WarszawaMaslo orzechowe na maksa, albo jak ktores z cuksow takich z alko... porter bardzo schowany z tylu... Ale mimo to zajebiscie... Byle nieduzoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

65cl bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured black with a small one finger tan head. Aromas: Massive peanut butter & milk chocolate up front, then marshmallow, vanilla, roasted pecan nuts. Smells absolutely divine! Taste: chocolate milk, peanut butter, nougat, Nuts candy bar, vanilla, roasted coffee beans, Haagse Hopjes (Dutch caramel/coffee treats), salty licorice, roasted pecan nuts. Medium carbonation. Nice creamy, roasty mouthfeel. Medium to full body with a roasted, bittersweet finish. This is an absolute stonker of a beer! Reminds me of fluffy salted caramel frosting on chocolate/peanutbutter cupcake...Delicious!
22 ounce bottle from maybe Jungle Jim¬ís. Really big nose. Taste is all coffee and peanut butter. Not a heavy body, but rich in taste. Very nice and tasty.

Bomber, no BB.
Brune, col fin blanc cass√© lassant un l√©ger dor√© au verre.
Ar√¥me met pas mal de caf√© et de peanut butter en avant avec un r√©tro espresso et pointe d¬íhoublon vert citronn√©.
Palais est finemetn amer niveau caf√©, malt pale, caramel et chocolat, le tout deveint un peu trop √©pais sur la fin vu la consistence du peanut butter. Grains perce sur la fin avec une fine amertume des houblons - restant dans un profil noble.
Draft. Dark pour with tan head. Roasted, peanuts, coffee and chocolate aromas. Flavors are similarly sweet, roasted chocolate, coffee and peanuts.
Tap @ CBC2016. Pours black with a small brown head. Notes of peanut, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, dry cocoa, malt.

22oz bottle 7/28/16 (Courtesy of TerryR)-42¬∞ in English Pint-Pours black with a big tan head. Aroma of chocolate milk. Taste of chocolate, peanut butter, and coffee. This medium bodied brew has a lot going on but I have to say not a lot of coffee. I am not a fan of coffee but this beer still rocks but maybe change the name.

22 ounce bottle

I figured that I would grab this because it stood a better chance of not getting stuck in the logjam of imperial stouts that are Hoppin¬í Frog¬ís trademark at this point. Indeed it didn¬ít let me down much. If not for the price I would consider buying a few more especially if it turns out to be more of a seasonal than a limited one off.

Aroma / Appearance - A fluid black base supports a pillar of mocha head with a creamy profile. Chocolate dipped coffee beans enrich the air along with a malty backbone. The sweet edge cuts into the dry feel of the porter¬ís heart.

Flavor / Palate - A thin bodied and sweet feel permeates the tongue, throat, and more with a texture of dairy creamer. The finish falls a bit short of fantastic though it does get the job done well enough that finishes the bottle was not a chore. Chocolate and bitter coffee wrap up this novel twist on Silk Porter. I¬íd still probably rather take the plain Silk Porter though if given the choice.

650 ml bottle from Beergium. Pours pitch black with a nice brown head. Aromas of peanut butter, coffee, some chocolate. Very good! Flavor is on the sweet side, with peanut butter and chocolate up front, some coffee and roasted notes. Medium body with low carbonation. Very nice!

Black with a beige light tan smooth head. Aromas of roasted malts, coffee, peanut butter are dominant but also offers notes of earth, chocolate, hints of butterscotch and treacle. Very fine perlage with a smooth mild even silky texture with a medium-full body. Some peanut butter sweetness leaving enough room for roast malt bitterness to shine. Nicely balanced with a lasting light slick finish. Welcoming Porter any day!
UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Draft - Roast peanuts and chocolate. Jet black with a decent beige head. Peanuts and chocolate with a very light palate. A little watery.

650ml bottle from boxbeers.com


Black colour with a beige head. Strong coffee, chocolate, nuts, vanilla, light body. Super easy drinkability.

A black beer, a head is creamy, medium and beige. Aroma is marvellous, richness of chocolate, lots of nuts, sweetness, some coffee, notes of vanilla. Taste has lots of pleasant nuts, chocolate, coffee, balanced sweetness, some bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth and pleasant in the mouth. More strenght body would be also great, but otherwise, like this, lighter to drink. Brilliant beer, huge flavours of nuts and chocolate.

Coffee, peanut butter, milk chocolate, nuts and caramel aroma. Pours dark brown with a thin, tan head. I taste milk chocolate, peanut butter and some coffee. Sweet finish, though coffee flavour lingers.. Oily and flat. Very good beer.

sample, poured a deeper dark brown colour with a tanned head. nose of sweet toasted malts, toffee, sweet bakers chocolate, peanuts, slight hop bitterness, milk chocolate, coffee notes, taste has more peanuts coming forward. interesting porter

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 Draught @ Fermentoren, Halmtorvet 29 c, Copenhagen, Denmark 1700. [ As Hoppin Frog Tower Tuesday: Infusion A - Coffee Porter ].Clear medium to dark black color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, sweet malt, coffee, dusty - nutty - hazelnuts - roasted peanut, dark malt, strong coffee aroma. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, coffee, sweet malt, dark malt, dusty - nutty - hazelnuts - roasted peanut, strong coffee. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160511]  8-4-8-4-16 
Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Blue Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hoppin Frog Infusion A: Chocolate Peanut Butter Porter ].Unclear dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, peanutbutter, dusty, nutty. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, peanuts, chocolate, coffee, dusty malt, roasted. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20160513]  8-3-8-4-16
Bottle in wine glass. This aroma is amazing. These notes follow through well on the palate but it isn¬ít accompanied by enough body. Still a great coffee porter though.

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours brown with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, peanut butter, light spice. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, chocolate, peanut butter, vanilla, chocolate cake. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. 130516

Draught @ CBC 2016, Blue session, K√∏benhavn
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, peanutbutter and coffee. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long nutty, chocolate and coffee finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
@ Basunen 16-6-18: Stor doft av nougat. Smaken √§r mycket s√∂t med stora toner av nougat och n√∂tter samt kaksmet. F√∂r s√∂tt.

CBC. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hop and vegetables. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vegetables, medium sweet, hops and a little bitter.
Bottle. Pecan, coffee, chocolate toffee malt, and hay aroma. Dark brown with small head. Moderately sweet latte, chocolate malt, and mildly bitter herbal hay flavor. Nice body. Excellent.

Draft @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty strong coffee aroma. Roasted malty coffee chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty coffee chocolate finish.

Bottle pour opaque black with brown hue and thin tan head. Nose malted chocolate, peanut butter, coffee. Smells like a cappuccino from the automatic machine. Taste big chocolate with coffee added and ends with creamy peanut butter. Big nose and big sweet flavors.
CBC. Almost black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, heavy peanut butter and chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 130516

Bottle. Soda like appearance, head dissappears quickly. Chocolate on the nose and upfront in the taste. Slight coffee aroma, roasty aftertaste. A little bit too sweet, but enjoyable. Slight peanut butter aroma.

650ml bottle from Rays, served at cellar temperature and shared with bananabi11. Cola colored pour with a beige head. Aroma has huge chocolate, coffee and espresso. Luscious & decadent. Taste is of sweet cocoa, peanut butter, espresso, some lactose, some bakers chocolate. Medium bodied, super smooth, lowly carbonated, light alcohol, very well blended. Finishes a bit more sweeter than bittersweet. Tasty smooth and nice! 15

Keg at CBC CG, London. It pours a clean dark brown color with a medium brown head. Aroma is strong espresso, vanilla, raisins, roasted malts and dark chocolate. Taste is also medium sweet and lightly roasty in the finish, with bold coffee and dark chocolate notes, more vanilla and toffee. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, delicious

On tap at Craft Covent Garden, London, Saturday 21st May 2016 in the company of Jackie and Simon   Pours black as yer like with an off-white head. The aroma is almost identical to Buxton/Omnipollo Yellow Belly, peanut butter very much in evidence here. The flavour it¬ís not unlike Yellow Belly either albeit this is 6.2% and almost a session beer when compared to the mighty 11% Yellow Belly. I like this, chocolate, peanut butter whip around the mouth, it¬ís lovely, perhaps a little thin but that¬ís just because I like the mouthfeel of the Buxton Yellow Belly. A9 A4 T8 P4 Ov16 4.1
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is roasted coffee, vanilla, chocolate, taste is sweet, creamy, chocolate, coffee.

On tap at Local Cantina in Clintonville: brown pour, big tan head. big chocolate and peanut butter aroma. tastes are same but coffee holds it together and knocks down sweetness. drinkable thin palate. delicious overall.
On tap at CBC 2016. Dark caramel with a thin beige head. Caramel, peppermint, butter, vanilla. Full bodied with a sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Sample at CBC 2016. 

Black with a tan head. On the sweet side with coffee, chocolate, dark malt, nuts, caramel and some hints of fruit. The body was medium as was the carbonation.

Aroma and taste is roasted malty, big coffee prominence, charred burnt notes, with chocolate, nuts, caramel, cocoa, vanilla stokes, coffee roasted finish.

(on tap @ CBC 2016) Poured into the CBC tulip reveals a pitch black body with one finger of tan head that subsides leaving lace. Good regeneration. Aroma is very gratifying with clear notes of peanuts. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium to full body with a lingering, aromatic finish. Flavour has a little ascerbicity but it¬ís balanced very well by a mild sweetness that never becomes cloying to me. The aroma is also significantly present in the flavour.

Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Black beer with a nice beige head. Fruity caramel aroma, hazelnuts, chocolate notes, some Nutella. Chocolate and hazelnut flavor, caramel, vanilla notes. Rather sweet but still a decent beer.
CBC2016. Schwarze Farbe, mittelgro√üe br√§unliche Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Erdn√ºssen, r√∂stmalzig s√º√ü. Geschmack s√º√ü r√∂stmalzig, sehr nussig, Karamell.
@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, BLUEblack. Nutty mudcakey nose. Malty. Full bodied, dryish, bit thin actually. Slight dusty. Ok.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours dark brown with low tanned head
Aromas of vanilla, hazelnut, milk chocolate, caramel 
Taste has notes of hazelnut, nougats, caramel, brown sugar, milk chocolate
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of peanut butter, butterscotch, chocolate. Taste is sweet, peanuts and caramel, with a mocha finish. Medium to rich bodied and smooth with soft carbonation.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Pours pitch black with a smooth head. Aroma has massive amounts of peanut butter, biscuity roastiness and syrup. Taste is sweet and heavy with peanut butter, toffee and syrup. Finish is sweet, smooth and slightly roasty with loads of peanut butter. A total peanut butter overdose.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is almost black with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Coffee, chocolate, dryness and roasted malts.
With penut butter... Keg at cbc16.. M dark black... Thick tan head.. Soft sweet chocolate roast malts massive Peanut roast.. Dark chocolate.. Big Peanut Butter roast.. Pink wafers
Draft at Fermentoren. Near black with a small tan head. Aroma of huge coffee, fudge, milk chocolate. Flavour is above moderate sweet and and bitter. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Tap at Fermentoren. Poured clear medium brown with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is big coffee vanilla. The flavour is moderate sweet with a smooth dry coffee, spicy, creamy, sweet malt palate. Light bodied with soft carbonation.
From tap at Fermentoren. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, peanut butter, chocolate, caramel, hops, coffee and sweetness.
From tap. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malt and mocca. Lingering dark malty and mocca. Smooth roasted and dark malty finish.

Draft. A black beer with a dark Brown head. The aroma has notes of peanuts, chocolate, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, chocolate, and alcohol, leading to a dry roasted finish.

Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with a sudsy tan head. Aroma was oddly vegetal, slight peanut butter notes. Luckily the flavor was great. Chocolate, coffee, peanut butter, roast nuts. Full body, thinner texture, soft carbonation, and a smooth finish.

Bottle:
Pours black with a creamy tan head.
Aroma is rich, decadent-level fudge and chocolate chips.....after a bit of warming, the Peanut butter kicks in....
Flavour is pure, dark, sweet chocolate malt....creamy...dark coffee roast...and then the taste does the same trick as the aroma.....as if someone flipped a switch.....the peanut butter fairy swoops in and smacks you in the head...awesome, roasty peanut husk and butter......
Starts off great...and just gets better and better...
At the top of the Peanut Butter beers I¬íve had...
Absolutely excellent.....
Bomber from Capone¬ís. Pours a pitch black with a large foamy beige/tan head. Aroma of chocolate peanut butter and roasted malt. Taste of chocolate, peanut butter and malt. Much like a dessert.

Bottle. Awesome peanut butter aroma with chocolate pudding too. Tastes like peanut butter powder and dry chocolate with a mild bitterness. Thin to medium body. This could be great with a little more body and sweetness.

Black pour with a thin khaki head and light lacing .... Aroma of peanut butter, coffee, roasted malts, milk chocolate and light caramel malts .... Taste is of rich and sweet milk chocolate, roasted malts, peanut butter, fresh coffee and sweet caramel malts .... Has some depth but still has a thin Porter body .... Finish is of coffee, roasted malts and a light bitter bite with chocolate ..... A little slick and silky .... Well done

Bottle thanks to Chad. Pours a very dark brown with beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, peanut butter, cocoa. Medium mouth, rich, cocoa, peanut butter, roasted malt, nice sweetness, very nice.

Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, coffee, peanut butter, & chocolate/hazelnut; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, coffee, dark chocolate, hops, and some peanut butter; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Great aroma on this one - very good.

Sampled on draft at Vintage Estate this beer poured a black color with a large foamy tan head that left good lacing. The aroma was strong cocoa powder and coffee. The flavor was strong cocoa powder, coffee, toasty malts and then even more cocoa. Very long cocoa and coffee finish. Moderately full bodied and quite creamy. Fantastic!

22 oz bottle from Dutch¬ís at home. Pours a very dark brown color with a medium sized creamy khaki colored head. The aroma leaps from the glass with huge chocolate and peanut butter with more subtle roasted coffee. Great aroma that had me wonder why I hadn¬ít heard of this beer before until DrSilverworm¬ís rating. First taste has the coffee play a larger role than it did in the nose. Chocolate, peanut butter, mild roast, some lactose sweetness, dry, medium bodied, very smooth, the nose on this was great and the flavor is not far behind.

Pours black with a medium mocha head...nice lacing. Aroma has nice slightly sweet dark chocolate and peanut butter. Flavor follows suit and adds a healthy amount of fresh coffee and roastiness that overtake the sweetness and nuttiness nicely. Mouthfeel is medium and lively with a lingering roasty coffee finish that hints at PB and dark chocolate. Really tasty...slightly reminiscent of Willoughby PB Cup Coffee Porter.

22oz bottle, from Dutch¬ís. Enjoyed all to myself. Big chocolate and peanut butter aroma pipes up from out of the bottle, as soon as I pop the cap. Reminds me of a peanut butter chocolate milkshake. In the flavor, some coffee reveals itself, which is an awesome addition to the party. Color is very dark brown, with a ring of khaki head. Some bits of lace. Medium-plus body, with very light, crisp carbonation. Mild chewiness to this, but not nearly as full-bodied as other popular American porters, but I¬ím not bothered. The aroma is just ridiculous on this. Huge in the nose, even bigger in the flavor. Chocolate, peanut butter, coffee. Bigger sweet taste, but not much sugary slick sweetness in the finish that I was worried may be here. Kind of light dry finish. Good moderate-plus bitter taste too. Mild earthy character to the finish. Touch of lactose-type creaminess. This is great. I didn¬ít even realize this was going to be a peanut butter until I read the deScription on the side of the bottle, and it turned out great. Lighter body seemed to add a counterpoint of drinkability to the rich flavor.
[1/31/16] Bottle sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Black with a tan head. Huge chocolate aroma, peanut butter, Nutella. Sweet. Medium to full-bodied.

Pours a dark brown with a beige head. Aroma was of big peanut butter and coffee, no off aromas at all. Flavor was big nutty upfromt, smooth coffee, some chocolate, really clean and not astringent at all like some peanut butter berrs.

Draft sample at the source. The beer is a darker brown with a khaki head of foam. The aroma has nice peanut butter notes with a more subtle, roasty coffee character. Medium sweetness in the taste. The peanut butterstarts to get more like a toasted bread with peanuts on the side. Medium body, chewy mouthfeel, and more aubtle carbonation. Very good.
Had this one last year when it was unrateable ... 22oz bottle. Poured a black color with a tan head. Chocolate, peanut butter, roast, and coffee. Very nice ...

Bomber from a PUB¬íR member direct from Fred Karm¬ís hands. Pours dark black with tan head. Nose is rich dark malt, cacao, dark chocolate syrup, and peanut butter. Tastes rich, with a big dark malt, cacao, dark choc, peanut butter, and coffee flavor. This beer is extremely complex and absolutely delicious.

22 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Thanks to my friend Daniel for the trade. Black with 1.5 fingers of light tan head. Aromas of big sweet roasted coffee, dark chocolate, burnt sugar, caramel. Tastes of roasted coffee, milk and dark chocolate, rich peanut butter, caramel, a bit of vanilla. Medium body with a dry finish. Medium carbonation. Fantastic!
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Bottle. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of fresh peanut butter, milk chocolate, roast chocolate, coffee. Medium body.

Bottle... Muckfest 2014¬Ö This beer rocks!¬Ö Pours murky and dark brown with a mid-sized, creamy, beige head. Terrific retention. The nose is a fantastic swirl of coffee, peanut butter, hazelnut, chocolate cr√®me and vanilla. Medium-bodied and super creamy with lackluster carbonation. Deeply roasted coffee, chocolate, caramel and toasted nuts in the sweet, vanilla-driven flavor. World class beer!

On draught at the Hoppin¬í Frog Tasting Room on 04/19/2014 (deemed unratable initially, but subsequently allowed): The beer is a dark brown color with a medium foamy light beige head that diminishes steadily to a thin outer ring. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and peanut butter. Medium-bodied with flavors of roasted coffee, chocolate malt and peanut butter. The finish is roasty with a cocoa and peanut butter aftertaste. Enjoyable beer all around.

Bottle. Darkest brown pour with a thick tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, peanut butter and roasted malt. Malty and roasty flavor with coffee and chocolate before a peanut butter finish. Exquisite.

22 oz. bottle shared by JaBier, who showed me that this one should indeed be rateable because it was brewed with coffee and bottled, and not just pulled through a randall. Anyway, it pours a deep brown color with a small beige head that leaves some film and a ring. Notes of fudge, coffee, vanilla, chocolate, and a nuttiness that suggests peanut butter, but the sweeter version that would be inside a Reese¬ís. Surprisingly sweet, actually. That¬ís what differentiates it from the Cafe Silk Porter, to me. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a smooth, sweet mouthfeel. Interesting beer.
